text: Nina Viktorovna Baldycheva (; 18 July 1947 – 27 January 2019) was a Russian cross-country skier. She competed from 1970 to 1980. She won three medals at the Winter Olympics with a gold in the 4×5 km (1976), a silver in the 4×5 km (1980), and a bronze in the 5 km (1976). In the relay in 1976, she injured her left hand in a fall at the start, but completed the race. She was born in Travino, Pskov Oblast, Russia. Fyodorova died on 27 January 2019 in Saint Petersburg, aged 71.В Петербурге скончалась олимпийская чемпионка Нина Балдычева ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1947 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Olympic silver medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Soviet Union
title: Nina Fyodorova
